thread.title: Telephone owned by Adolf Hitler sells at auction for $243G
thread.title_full: Telephone owned by Adolf Hitler sells at auction for $243G

title: Telephone owned by Adolf Hitler sells at auction for $243G
text:
Telephone owned by Adolf Hitler sells at auction for $243G Telephone owned by Adolf Hitler sells at auction for $243G ASSOCIATED PRESS Adolf Hitler's personal traveling telephone sold for $243,000 at auction on Sunday. (Patrick Semansky/AP)   6:39 PM 
CHESAPEAKE CITY, Md. â€” A telephone owned by Adolf Hitler has sold at auction for $243,000. 
Andreas Kornfeld of Alexander Historical Auctions says the phone sold Sunday afternoon to a person who bid by phone. The auction house does not disclose the names of buyers. The red telephone includes a Nazi party symbol and Hitler's name engraved on the back. (Patrick Semansky/AP) 
Bidding for the phone started at $100,000. The phone was used in Hitler's first field headquarters. 
The red telephone includes a Nazi party symbol and Hitler's name engraved on the back. Occupying Russian officers gave the phone to a British officer, Sir Ralph Rayner, during a visit to Hitler's bunker in Berlin. The phone was used in vehicles and trains as well as Hitler's field headquarters. 
Kornfeld says a porcelain figure of an Alsatian dog, also owned by Hitler, also sold Sunday to a different bidder for $24,300. Join the Conversation:
